{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of headache, generalized tonic-clonic seizure, hypertension, and hyperreflexia with ankle clonus in the setting of pregnancy suggest a diagnosis of eclampsia. Eclampsia is a severe form of preeclampsia characterized by the development of seizures. Preeclampsia is a multisystem disorder characterized by hypertension and end-organ dysfunction after 20 weeks of gestation in a previously normotensive woman. One of the key diagnostic criteria for preeclampsia is proteinuria.", "answer_choice": "D. Proteinuria"}
